alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Hendricks; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 8:50AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hancock, southeastern Hendricks and Marion Counties through 915 AM EDT... At 850 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Speedway, or 7 miles west of Indianapolis, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Beech Grove and Southport around 910 AM EDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 102 and 122. Interstate 70 between mile markers 67 and 94. Interstate 74 between mile markers 68 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
